art.capt: cloud 1: 1 cirrus, 2 cirrostratus, 3 cirrocumulus, 4 altostratus, 5 altocumulus, 6 stratocumulus, 7 nimbostratus, 8 cumulus, 9 cumulonimbus, 10 stratus

entry.et: Middle English, rock, cloud, from Old English clūd; perhaps akin to Greek gloutos buttock

def.dt: :a visible mass of particles of condensed vapor (as water or ice) suspended in the atmosphere of a planet (as the earth) or moon
:something resembling or suggesting a cloud: as
:a light filmy, puffy, or billowy mass seeming to float in the air a cloud of blond hair a ship under a cloud of sail
:a usually visible mass of minute particles suspended in the air or a gas
:an aggregation of usually obscuring matter especially in interstellar space
:an aggregate of charged particles (as electrons)
:a great crowd or multitude :swarm clouds of mosquitoes
:something that has a dark, lowering, or threatening aspect clouds of war a cloud of suspicion
:something that obscures or blemishes a cloud of ambiguity
:a dark or opaque vein or spot (as in marble or a precious stone)

art.cap: cloud 1: 1 cirrus, 2 cirrostratus, 3 cirrocumulus, 4 altostratus, 5 altocumulus, 6 stratocumulus, 7 nimbostratus, 8 cumulus, 9 cumulonimbus, 10 stratus

def.dt: :to grow cloudy usually used with over or up clouded over before the storm
:to become troubled, apprehensive, or distressed in appearance her face clouded with worry
:to become blurry, dubious, or ominous often used with over the outlook is clouding over
:to billow up in the form of a cloud
:to envelop or hide with or as if with a cloud smog clouded our view
:to make opaque especially by condensation of moisture steam clouded the windows
:to make murky especially with smoke or mist smoke clouded the sky
:to make unclear or confused cloud the issue
:taint sully a clouded reputation
:to cast gloom over cloud prospects for success
:a vessel containing air saturated with water vapor whose sudden expansion reveals the passage of an ionizing particle by a trail of visible droplets
:a realm of fantasy or of whimsical or foolish behavior
:wood ear

:a wet tropical mountain forest at an altitude usually between 3000 and 8000 feet (1000 and 2500 meters) that is characterized by a profusion of epiphytes and the presence of clouds even in the dry season
:a feeling of well-being or elation usually used with on still on cloud nine weeks after winning the championship
:a row of cumulus clouds
mountain 13,165 feet (4013 m) N Wyoming; highest in Bighorn Mountains
:the system of electrons surrounding the nucleus of an atom
